lines.text: [in Jennifer's dream]
Can I ask you a question?
Why certainly.
[Dick Cavett turns into Freddy Krueger]
Who gives a fuck what you think?
your big break in TV.
[Jennifer screams]
Welcome to prime time, bitch!
Freddy's home.
What a rush!
Five, six, grab a crucifix. Seven, eight, better stay up late. Nine, ten, never... never...
Never sleep again. Where did you learn that rhyme?
I used to live in this house.
That's just a house I dream about.
I'm in.
Me, too.
Let's go kick the motherfucker's ass all over dreamland.
You're mine now, piggy.
What's wrong, Joey? Feeling tongue-tied?
Will, you look tired. Have a seat.
No thanks. I'm fine just the way I am.
For now, maybe... but when you wake up... It's back... in the saddle... again.
I said, "Where's the fucking bourbon?"
[decapitates mom]
You should listen to your mother.
God damn it, Kristen, you ruin everything! Every time I bring a man home you spoil it! You know what your shrink says? You're just trying to get a little attention!
Can I interject something just to save us all some time?
Sure, Phillip. Go ahead.

Well, according to our kind hosts, our dreams are a group psychosis. Sort of a mellow mass hysteria. The fact that we all dreamt about this guy before we ever met doesn't impress anybody. So we go in circles making minimal progress with maximum effort.
You won't make any progress until you recognize your dreams for what they are.
And what are they?
The by-products of guilt. Psychological scars stemming from moral conflicts and overt sexuality.
Oh, great. Now it's my dick that's killing me.
The man in my dreams... he's real, isn't he?
He's real.
It's the chair for you, kid.
I am the Wizard Master. I AM the Wizard Master.
Let's snuff the sucka.
Ain't gonna dream no more, no more. Ain't gonna dream no more. All night long I sing this song. Ain't gonna dream no more.
Taryn. Taryn.
What?
Why, uh, why should we fight? We're old friends, you and I. Remember?
[heroin needles form on fingertips]
Let's get high.
[Freddy lifts Kincaid by the throat]
He's strong. He's never been this strong.
Yes. The souls of the children...
[rips open his sweater revealing faces of children on his chest]
...give me strength.
Oh, God.
Always room for more.
Joey... look. All the little PIGGIES come home.
Let him go, Krueger.
Your wish... is my command.
Who is he?
His name is Freddy Krueger. He was a child murderer before he died, and after he died... well, he became something worse.
[in Nancy's old house]
This is where he takes us.

[walks in the TV room]
Girl, what are you doing?
Watching TV.
I can see that. Why don't you read a book? You watch too much damn TV.
Research.

[sarcastically]
Oh, right. You're gonna be a TV star.
Wait and see.

[about to turn off the TV]
Well, if Simms catches you up here after lights out she is gonna chew my ass...

[interrupting Max]
I gotta stay up, Max!
Jennifer.
Just tonight, please? I can't handle the nightmare. Not after Phillip. Not tonight.
Okay. But I never saw you.
Thanks, Max.
Well just go ahead and fight. 'Cause that what he wants.
Who?
Who do you think? What does he want?
To turn us against each other other so we'll be be weak. Easy pray.
Horseshit.
No, she's right.
What was that nursery rhyme all about?
It was just something that that the kids say to keep the... Boogieman away.
Fred Kreuger is dead. You've always had such a hard time understanding that.
You know what he did. He's doing it again.
She's telling the truth, sir.
I don't think we've ever met, friend. This doesn't concern you.
I think we can stop him. Stop him for good this time, but we need to know where his bones were hidden.
It was good seeing you again, princess. Next time, don't stay away so long.
[Taryn finds herself in a back alley face-to-face with Freddy]
Welcome home, Taryn. Look familiar?
Okay, asshole. Let's dance!
[first title card]
"Sleep. Those little slices of Death. How I loathe them." - Edgar Allen Poe
Yo, Freddy! Where you hiding at, you burnt-faced pussy?
Hey! We should, find the others first.
You think you're hot shit with the little mute kid, don't ya? Well let me see you come get a piece of me! Krueger! Pussy! Yeah, I knew he was a little chicken.
[Door appears behind them]
Shit.
It's a door.
But, it doesn't go anywhere.
Yes, it does.
This is it. Are you ready?
Let's snuff, the sucka!
It's now or never. I'm not gonna kid you, this is as dangerous as it gets. If you die in this dream it's for real. Nobody has to go in that doesn't want to.
[while fighting with Dr. Simms]
You stupid bitch, you're killing us... YOU'RE KILLING US.
I'm not going to take any more of this. How much longer are you going to go on blaming your dreams for your own weaknesses?
Lady, how much longer you gonna keep blowin' smoke up our ass?
That's enough, Kincaid!
There will be no repeat occurrences of last night's events. From now on your doors will be locked during sleeping hours. We'll start a policy of evening sedation for everybody.

[Jumping out of his seat]
The fuck you will! Anybody tries drugs on me gets his ass kicked!
Well, you just bought yourself a night in the quite room, Mister. Now sit down!
Fuck you! You sit down!
Phillip, wake up... Have a nice stroll, asshole.

This lump over here... This is Kincaid. Now I want you to take a good look. See, he gets himself thrown in the quite room so often that you probably won't see a whole lot of him. Ain't that right, "Cool Breeze"?
Right. I do it so I don't have to look at your ugly face all the time.
Yeah, I love you too.

[talking to Neil]
Only one thing can save the children now. The unquiet spirit must be laid to rest...

[walking up to Neil]
Neil? What are you doing up here?
Oh, I was just talking to...
[turns around and Mary Helena is gone]
To who?

[after Nancy explains Freddy Krueger's history]
That's crazy. Mom and Dad never mentioned any...

[Taryn interrupts]
Oh right, that's the sort of thing parents tell their kids... "Goodnight darling. Say your prayers. Oh and by the way, your father and I torched some maniac last night".

[after coming across a gravestone reading "Amanda Krueger Her Name in Christ, Sister Mary Helena"]
My God. You were his mother.
Say, listen Doc, I got a new theory about all these suicides. Right?
Don't hold back on us, Max. We need all the help we can get.
It's fucked up chromosomes, man. Think about it. All their parents dropped acid during the sixties.
Well, it beats Simm's theory. She thinks it's nothing but sex, drugs, and rock 'n' roll.
Shit. That's what keeps people alive.
I'm Jennifer Caulfield, and as soon as I get out of here, I'm going to Los Angeles to be an actress. I'm going to be on TV.
Yeah. Lifestyle of the Rich and Psychotic.
Screw you.
Hi, sweet stuff. Good news.

[disinterested, trying to get past him]
Can't be good news, coming from you.
Pulled night duty.
So?

[twirling keys]
So, got the keys to heaven, baby.
What?
The dispensary. I'm talking clean pharmaceutical high, a night at Club Meth.
I don't do that shit.

[grabs Taryn's wrist exposing needle tracks on her arm]
Yeah? What are those, beauty marks?
Those are ancient history.
Oh, yeah? Well, if you're ever in the mood for a history lesson, I'm your teacher. Understand?
Stay out of my face, or I'll go straight to Max.
Oh, yeah? Now who's going to take the word of a crazy junkie chick like you?
Fuck off!

[to Doctor Gordon and Doctor Simms]
Suicide attempt. They just brought her down from County General.
What's her name.
Kristen Parker. She was fine until we tried to sedate her!

[to Don Thompson]
Hi, I'm Dr. Neil Gordon. There, now we've met!
[Grabs Don against a wall unexpectedly]
Now you listen to me! I don't know if you care whether or not Nancy dies, but I do!
[a silent pause passes between the men]
Now, we're going to go on a little scavenger hunt.

[when getting caught stealing a crucifix]
Oh! I'm sorry, but I really need this. Here. Take my driver's license.
Daddy?
I've crossed over, princess.
Crossed over?
I couldn't go without telling you how sorry I am for all the things I've done. I love you so much. I'll always love you.

[hugs him]
I'll always love you.
[Thompson turns into Freddy and stabs Nancy in her stomach]
DIE.
In the name of Lowrek, Prince of Elves... demon, begone.
[zaps at Krueger with magical beams while running toward him]
Ahh.
[grabs Stanton and halts zapping]
Sorry, kid. I don't believe in fairy tales.
In my dreams I'm beautiful.
[flicks open two switchblades]
And bad!
It's really you. I've killed you once before, you son of a bitch.
Hi. Welcome to the snake pit.

[about Phillip]
He wasn't strong enough, so he got wasted. That's all.
That's all? Is that what you think?
He couldn't hack it, so he got nailed. Period.
Oh, yeah. Big, tough bad-ass. How much long are you gonna last?
I'm gonna last longer than any of you.
Good. You conquered the demon, but you're horse is sinking in the bog. What do you do?
I got to bed, and I buy a new horse in the morning.

[to Joey]
How do I score that, enchanted slumber or death?
[Joey motions of slicing throat]
[as Joey screams destroying Freddy's Hall of Mirrors to save the others]
Wow. Did I say that?
You found your dream power man.
You saved us, Joey.

[picks up Joey]
You blew him away!
In my dreams I can walk. My legs are strong. In my dreams I am the Wizard Master.
[to Dr. Neil Gordon]
If your only faith is science, doctor, it may be you that's laid to rest.
Sleep, those little slices of death, how I loathe them.

[after exposing her breasts to Joey]
Do you like my body, Joey?
